author: lovegrovegeorge
title: Catalyst Site: Collaborators list
description: It's difficult for newcomers and proposers to find people for collaboration on a proposal or get advice on engaging in Project Catalyst.

assessments.note: I think that bringing together people who would like to propose an idea but are lacking some skill, can be very beneficial and increase the number of proposed ideas.

This is a creative and innovative solution to the campaign challenge - It creates a collaborator list or 'marketplace' where community members can look for teams and teams can look for members.  This would definitely make it easier for community members to collaborate and give a simple 'first step' to participating in PC (project catalyst).  However, even though there is budget for 'Marketing' it is unclear how the proposal will encourage 'outside proposers' - people from outside of the community.  This is only a slight problem with alignment to the campaign.  The proposal could be more clear in how it would bring 'outside proposers' into the community.  For instance, connection with other networks or more details about the marketing.

When joining Ideascale, probably a lot of people don't already have a proposal in mind. Being able to have a database of collaborators that is easy to use and understand will help them find their place faster and together produce high-quality proposals, that themselves would generate interest from other entrepreneurs and bring them to Project Catalyst.

This proposal appears to meet the requirements of reaching out to the community to bridge collaboration amongst the community.  All developers and collaborators who take part in this would benefit and scaling doesn't appear to be an issue.

The proposal meets the objectives of the challenge very well, because it proposes to create a website that facilitates the visualization, by new interested parties, of the people who make up the Catalyst project and their functions and skills. New members of the community may indeed have to understand the project as a whole, and by understanding its members and their functions, it is possible to establish a direct exchange of information with them, these difficulties can be effectively remedied. The proposal would also facilitate the flow of ideas by new members, who choose the person with the most suitable profile for their claims, and would greatly increase the visibility of the team as a whole. Note: 5.

I feel confident that this team and proposal will be implemented successfully. The teamleader is a professional web developer according to his linkedin profile.  The two other team members have complementary skills.   The roadmap and documentation of milestones (on the notion website) is clear and adequate.  I would like to see that 'challenges and risks' are considered.  For instance, what if no one comes to the website?  Based on the interactions with commenters and the profile of the team leader, I feel he will overcome challenges faced by the proposal.  I would like to see a more clear goal that says what success looks like.  For instance, the success metric states 'number of users'.  How many users to the system do they estimate in the short and long term?
The team seems to be highly qualified and the plan is well laid out. Since they are already working on it I see no problem with it being implemented successfully.

The expereince of the team appears to be sufficient to build, develop, and implement a project of this scope and size.  There is a roadmap included which already has commitment to this project outside of the proposal (through work in Notion).  The budget seems appropriate for the resources required for the desired features and scope of this project.

The author of the proposal claims to have 5 years of experience with content development for web and mobile, and even attached his profile on linkedin, where you can see several places he worked as a developer. Through these examples, a lot of confidence is established in your ability to develop the project. In addition, the author also considers forming a team with Design professionals, content writers and other developers, that is, he is aware of the complexity and need for plurality that the project team requires. Note: 5.

Short and long term metrics are well designed, but it would be nice to see how exactly they plan to measure the long term metrics - Tracking interactions between collaborators to determine if more collaborations are fostered through the collaboration list

This proposal highlights a problem that needs to be solved.  There are over 20 comments which show that the community is interested and the problem is real. The community will benefit from the launch of this proposal and will scale as a part of several other components of a community website (which are separate proposals in this fund, but not this campaign).  

The central idea of the proposer outreach campaign and the PC process, in general, is to harness the value from the community and interested people, if funded, this Collaborators list would reduce the barriers to entry for a single collaborator AND well encourage diversity and team building.  This collaborator list will increase the innovative ideas and proposals to our community by increasing the number and quality of proposals and team members.

The proposer is fully committed and the process has started.
It is not clear how this reaches entrepreneurs outside the Cardano ecosystem.
assessments.reply: The proposal aims to help make it more effective to do proposal outreach by giving newcomers a way to easily interact with the community and let others know they want to participate. If the challenge objectives are that the proposal implementation itself must do proposal outreach then this comment would be considered fair. If the challenge objectives also include tools that help improve proposal outreach then this would be an onconstructive comment as the proposal aims to help improve the marketing funnel taking someone from new to the ecosystem through to a potential proposer. We believe this tool will help with proposal outreach and there are also comments in the proposal highlight potential collaboration with some of the advertising efforts. We appreciate this is subjective however and fully depends on whether campaign objectives outcomes should be strictly doing actual proposal outreach or can be tooling that could help with improving proposal outreach process.

assessments.note: The proposal is inspired by a real need of the Catalyst community and the team seems to be genuinely interested in improving the website. Therefore, they have included all the relevant information, leaving no room for potentially unanswered questions.

The project lays out a feasible roadmap and plans on how to implement the collaborator list.  The project does include success metrics, although they could be a little more fleshed out and made more black and white.  Challenges on how to build a complete list of collaborators should be included (such as social media engagement, etc...)

The author details what the initial and subsequent objectives of his project are, as well as how to achieve them, and attaches a website where you can follow the progress of the project, in weeks. Define a base of skills to be distributed by members of the Catalyst project, create mechanisms that work through DATA to link information (skills with people)... There are several steps detailed here, in addition to an approximation in weeks of how long each would finish being made. In this way, it is possible to see how well the plan is already structured, a clear step by step of what to do, how and when. In addition, it also details very well how the financing money would be used.

solution: A list of potential collaborators and their skills that want to take part in proposals.
experience:
5+ years of web and mobile development experience

1 year of strategic consulting (external & inhouse) experience
